description.narrative: Sector: Fruit processing.Beneficiaries: 238 (81 women).Description: Casa Ecologie is in the processing of increasing its production so that it can satisfy its growing customer base. Although production is increasing every year, they are limited by the capacity of the current processing equipment, and by the lack of a cooling capacity for raw material. The project will increase production capacity, as well as necessary storage capacity to ensure year round rather than seasonal production. title.narrative: ASHOKA | Hope Telemedicine

description.narrative: Every minute on average a woman dies worldwide from complications related to a lack of blood. Moreover, in developing countries, up to 65% of blood transfusions are administered to children under 5 years of age. (Sources: WHO). Our ambition with the HOPE project is to fight effectively against the lack of blood in health structures. In other words, no human life lost, no delayed surgery, no treatment of children with haemophilia or sickle cell disease, ...etc. The innovations introduced by the HOPE project will be the standards used in all African countries and even in the world to fight against blood shortages in blood structures.

title.narrative: Young African Leaders Initiative (YALI) | CARVI Beef Jerky Processing Project

description.narrative: Within five years, I see this initiative as the leader in agri-business in Africa. I see it playing a big role in this field and making his products available to the world. I see it having a social impact of greater and greater importance by offering his support to young local producers who have naturally faced the same challenges. Our mission is to contribute to food security, the financial independence of farmers and the eradication of hunger in Africa. Carvi Food is currently in food processing via beef jerky production. However, the company does not intend to stay at this stage. Its ambition is to evolve by taking control of the entire process from meat production to the implementation of a solid distribution system, established both at national and international level.

title.narrative: CITI-Poultry production of COOPERA Farm

description.narrative: The project aims at the social and economic reintegration of vulnerable populations in the rural region of Mbarigo. This project will enable young people (men and women) living in vulnerable situations and without access to traditional education to acquire practical knowledge leading to better work and future opportunities. This project offers several long-term benefits for the people of Mbarigo, including job creation, growth of the local economy, and the empowerment and improvement of the living conditions of the project beneficiaries. In addition, we will work with local partners (GDS, SCL and Gaston Berger University) to develop reintegration opportunities into the labour market. We would like, after a few years, to be able to form an annual cohort of 15-20 young people. For example, Cooperative Integrated Farms would support capacity building for young people (men and women) living in and around the village of Mbarigo. The development and growth of economic activities in this region will help improve the living conditions of targeted young people.

The Action Council Association (ACA), a non-profit organization based in Senegal, will provide technical assistance to beneficiary groups of the United States African Development Foundation (USADF) across Senegal. ACA will offer tailored grant design, implementation support, and technical assistance to meet the unique needs of each beneficiary group. This collaboration will help grantees overcome challenges, execute their projects successfully, achieve their desired outcomes, and attain long-term sustainability.

title.narrative: Echoing Green (EG) - Teach for Senegal

description.narrative: USADF is providing funding for Raby Gueye, an Echoing Green fellow, and her organization, Teach For Senegal (TFS). TFS is in the education sector and is modeled after Teach for America and seeks to enlist young Senegalese graduates to work as full-time teachers in undeserved communities throughout Senegal for two years. TFS seeks to provide quality education to the nearly 45% of Senegal's population that is below the age of 15 and provide them with the best change to succeed in a 21st century Senegal. The experience also furthers the development of these young students in leadership skills as well as diversifying their experience and knowledge of their home country.
